com.yantra.api.omp.order

Interface getOrderLineList

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    com.yantra.api.OMPApi, YIFApi

    public interface getOrderLineList

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      org.w3c.dom.Document getOrderLineList(YFSEnvironment env, org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
      The getOrderLineList API returns a list of order lines that satisfy a set of criteria, such as range of OrderLineKeys, OrderNo, dates and status, from the transaction or history tables.

    • Method Detail

      • getOrderLineList

        org.w3c.dom.Document getOrderLineList(YFSEnvironment env,
                                      org.w3c.dom.Document inXML)
                               throws com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException,
                                      java.rmi.RemoteException
        The getOrderLineList API returns a list of order lines that satisfy a set of criteria, such as range of OrderLineKeys, OrderNo, dates and status, from the transaction or history tables. Criteria can be entered for multiple attributes, such as finding all OrderLines with a range of OrderLineKeys, with a certain Status.
        Once an order completes its normal life cycle, it is archived into history tables. The getOrderLineList API returns information from either the current or history transaction tables. Pass ReadFromHistory as Y to read from the history tables, N to read from the current tables, or B to read from both. If status attributes such as FromStatus, ToStatus or Status are passed, then Delivery lines will not be considered while giving the output.

        This API also supports 'GENERIC' pagination strategy through the getPage API. See getPage API for more information.

        If EnterpriseCode or DocumentType are not passed in the root element, then CustomAttributes element passed in the input filter will be ignored.

        Related Documents
        Input XML Input DTD Output XML Output DTD Error XML Error DTD

        User Exits: None

        Validations: None

        Events Raised: None

        Audits: None

        Pre-conditions: None

        Post-conditions:
        A list of order lines that satisfy the input criteria is returned. Use the getOrderLineDetails() API to get details about these order lines.

        Output Template Support:
        Yes. Some of the elements and attributes are not template driven. Refer to output xml for element level details.

        Database Extensibility Support: Yes

        Parameters:
        inXML - Required. Criteria for which a list of order lines must be returned. For more information, see the associated input xml files.
        env - Required. Environment handle returned by the createEnvironment API.

        Returns:
        An XML document that contains a list of order lines. For details on the output, refer to the associated output files.
        Throws:
        java.rmi.RemoteException - Java's default remote exception handler.
        com.yantra.yfs.japi.YFSException - Exception containing error codes in the standard error files.
